comment: He has very little to do with the actual project. You choose from a list of set projects. He like your progress project of the project. He will tell you everything he doesn't like and for the next presentation you'll have to fix all of the issues and make more progress. If you have a good group and work well together this class will be a easy A.

Ken Hoganson only cares to interact with students during presentations. If you need assistance he will not help you and usually won't respond to your email. Expect to be clueless about what the professor expects from you because it is never made clear. To get a good grade, you need to make sure your group members can write good things about you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: At the end of the day, the teacher isn't horrible but he's not helpful. If you constantly ask questions or need assistance, you are going to hate him. However, he is fair. If you and your group do the work, then you'll be fine.

This is the first and only review I've left of my college career. If there was an award for the rudest professor, it would go to Dr. Hoganson. For presentations, he was late or didn't show up at all, even after he responded to our emails. After showing up late, he'd completely berate a group's project for having any flaws whatsoever. Do not take.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I don't ever write professor reviews but Hoganson has been so universally mediocre that I had to make an exception. Let me count the ways: - Terrible communicator: has ignored almost all of my correspondence - Incompetent: has made countless mistakes and doubled down that he didn't, harming grades. - And so much more beyond this character limit.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Echoing some of the other reviews on this page, Hoganson is definitely not fit to be teaching right now. He is extremely rude and always feels the need to talk down to his students as if they have done something wrong. His feedback is minimal and extremely unhelpful. He didn't respond to a single email from my group. Worst prof at KSU hands down.

Ken Hoganson is the laziest and most incompetent prof you will ever have. He is unfit to teach, impossible to reach, and very late to class meetings and presentations. He offers little to no feedback, is very grumpy and very unorganized. If hes your only option, good luck. KSU needs to get rid of him

Took this class online, and he seems nice enough. His powerpoints do very little to explain the content, and he's probably the most unorganized professor I've ever had. I don't feel like I learned much, but he's a pretty lenient grader, and all hws/tests are open note/book/internet.

He is the only option but he's awful. Grades arbitrarily and absolutely roasts you when presenting. Very hard to get in contact with.. If he doesn't like your project you will not do well, even if you put good work in. Typical tenured professor with an ego.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The three tags I chose above are the best description in the complete opposite way of this professor. Impossible get in contact with. Feedbacks are nonexistent. Unclear instructions. Poor communication. But, like the previous person mentioned, this is the only option for CS4850. Good luck everyone.

I had Ken Hoganson for senior project, and he was a pain at the best of times to have as a professor. He was frequently late to our presentations (online because of COVID), and he never even replied to the only two emails I ever sent him. Good luck though, as last I checked, he's your only option for senior project.

Didn't really learn much and stopped trying halfway through the semester. Easy A if you put in effort probably but I didn't learn anything. Get ready to decipher all of his lecture content if you take the online version, he is so unorganized it's pathetic to pay actual money for this. If you want to waste $1400 on a class this is the one for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor is EXTREMELY difficult to get in contact with. I had him for senior project and was having group issues. Ended up doing nearly the entire project by myself and still recieved an unsatisfactory grade. COULD NOT get in contact with about the uneven share of work.

I took Ken for Senior Project. Its hard to say how tough he grades considering we showed up twice a month and its based on one project. He seems to really push you to your limits but it understanding and comforting when you fall short and sees the effort. Seemed like a really nice and awesome guy. I wouldnt take his syllabus too seriously.

Slides are very hard to go off of alone (disorganized, do not include a lot of info that ends up being tested), but lectures drone on and are not easy to keep focus on, making it hard to learn the material properly. Very easy to get an A however as he doesn't change tests and HWs from previous semesters much. BLUF: Easy A, but didn't learn much.

The subject matter is difficult but his homeworks and tests are not. Lectures are fast paced and cover some complicated material, but don't worry. The tests (all take-home) are extremely reasonable and he gives generous extra credit points too. I don't recommend skipping the lectures because many of the slides are cryptic.

Ken is a nice individual, but the course is extremely boring due to his style (and probably the content). It's easy to swindle an A+, as the tests are open-everything, for online and in-class students alike, with tons of extra credit. Alternatively, you can try to learn AMAP, but suffer through the boringness for what will feel like eternity.

Dr. Hoganson is a subject matter expert. While a little disorganized at times, he knows his stuff well. While he mainly reads from the slides and leaves you to figure out what is going on in class, he is easily accessible during office hours. While the material is fairly complex, he makes it fun. I would take a class with him again!
Great prof, very knowledgable and helpful.

I consider this professor to be a very kind and knowledgeable individual, however when I took him for my programming class he was not a very helpful in regards to helping his students understand javascript. When you take his class you will have a TA, so you will not be completely helpless, but he did not teach nearly as much as I needed him to.
Fun course and nice guy. The content is hard to make interesting but I was familiar already with using a database to store information. I had a high level of interest coming into the class.

Nice guy, rather helpful if you're willing to take the time AFTER class and ask for help -- in-class things move at a breakneck pace with little breathing space for most of the semester. Still, he's very practical and is willing to explain things in more detail whenever he can. HARD tests; you have to really work for a good grade. Study hard!
Excellent professor. Fun and easygoing, explains concepts and examples well.

If you're looking for a smart professor keep looking. He had no games or software he had written, but he could point out all the mistakes in yours. Typical of the CS/IS depts at KSU. No experience in the field whatsoever. Tried to get us to pay to make a presentation at a KSU game conference. Opinion, not craft, rules this class so beware. 0/10 Avoid the fail train!
awsome professor.. he is excellent
